result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan A Keson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contributing to Truancy, a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.45(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs & DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with conditions as stated in 16CM38.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: letter from Atty Brian T Kane dated 06/17/16 in re:  request for copy of JOC - original filed in 16CM38

Defendant Johnathan A Keson in court with attorney Brian T. Kane. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 16CM-38, 16CM-63 and 16CM-62.

10:56 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

State files two uncharged read in cases. 16PT-533 (bailjumping) and 16PT-78 (contributing to truancy).

Address of Defendant is verified. 

There is a plea agreement.
16CM-38: Defendant will plead to 3 counts.
16CM-62: Defendant will plead to Count 1.
16CM-63: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Defense is free to argue.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant understands.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM-38: Count 1 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 16CM-38: Count 2 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 16CM-38: Count 3 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 16CM-62: Count 1 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 16CM-63: Count 1 NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kane for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CM-38: Count 1: contributing to truancy to H.L.K.
16CM-38: Count 2: contributing to delinquency of H.L.K.
16CM-38: Count 3: contributing to delinquency of H.L.K.
16CM-62: Count 1: contributing to truancy of J.N.K.
16CM-63: Count 1: contributing to truancy of H.L.K.
16CM-63: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Court accepts the two statements of uncharged read ins that was filed with the Court.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kane makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends no conditional jail. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CM-38:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 30 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for 3 Years
Conditions:
Cooperate with the school and get the children to school every day unless they have a legitimate excuse
Comply with any CHIPS order that affects your children while on probation
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

16CM-38:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 30 Days, concurrent to Count 1 , Imposed and Stayed
Probation for 3 Years, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
No DNA Surcharge

16CM-38:
Count 3:
Jail sentence for 30 Days, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for 3 Years, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs
No DNA Surcharge

16CM-62:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 30 Days, consecutive to16CM-38, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for 3 Years, concurrent to 16CM-38
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 16CM-38
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Court will not impose the 5 day jail sentence at this time

16CM-63:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 30 Days, consecutive to16CM-38 and 16CM-62, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for 3 Years, concurrent to 16CM-38 and 16CM-62
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 16CM-38 and 16CM-62
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Plea hearing on May 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
